snippet.textDisplay: My problem with this trilogy is that I have no idea how these movies were even made? I've worked in the film industry for a while, a few years in the production office on some big series and when you work on a large scale story like a trilogy or a series, even if you have a vague outline,  the writers and the directors plus heads of departments have countless story meetings when developing the scripts. This trilogy feels like JJ and Kathleen had some notes on a napkin and just winged it. You can't blame Ryan Johnston if the people in charge had no idea what the story was. Even though the prequels were poorly executed, Lucas had a pretty epic and imaginative story planned out.
snippet.textOriginal: My problem with this trilogy is that I have no idea how these movies were even made? I've worked in the film industry for a while, a few years in the production office on some big series and when you work on a large scale story like a trilogy or a series, even if you have a vague outline,  the writers and the directors plus heads of departments have countless story meetings when developing the scripts. This trilogy feels like JJ and Kathleen had some notes on a napkin and just winged it. You can't blame Ryan Johnston if the people in charge had no idea what the story was. Even though the prequels were poorly executed, Lucas had a pretty epic and imaginative story planned out.

snippet.textDisplay: Well said. What bothered me most is that they drop this bombshell that Rey is Palpatine's grandaughter (a common fan theory going way back) and I'm thinking...What?  Palp had a woman? Palp had a son? What do we know about that? Nothing. At least give us SOMETHING. Show an flashback or vision of Palpatine yelling at his son and daughter-in-law complaining about how weak his son is.  Show him finding out about them having a child with abilities. Develop that just a little more! If they had added even 15 minutes of development of that story, it would have flowed MUCH better for me. Also, explain to me how there is an abandoned ship smack dab in the middle of a desert, (Rey's Parents' Ship) on a hill where everyone can see it, for like 25 years, and it can fly into space, and NO ONE had ever tried to steal it? I mean I know there's a cartoonish element, but c'mon. I have spoken.

snippet.textDisplay:
Thanks for the honest review, Chris. A lot of negative reviews are quite sensationalized and, honestly, I'm having a hard time taking them seriously.



I don't believe that Anakin's arc was ruined, because Anakin was among the myriad of Jedi who combined their power to defeat Palpatine. Rey did not defeat Palpatine. The Jedi defeated the Sith--that's a very important caveat. I also believe that Anakin killed Palpatine in Return of the Jedi and that this is Palpatine's corpse, preserved with chemicals and sustained by the Dark Side.



I also imagine what the Star Wars fans would say if Anakin HAD appeared.


"Oh my God, I can't believe that Anakin's Force ghost fought Palpatine. How cheesy."


"Wow. You basically repeated Return of the Jedi, Jar Jar Abrams."


"Anakin found peace in Return of the Jedi! You completely destroyed Star Wars, and my childhood, Disney!"


I loved the movie, but I do have issues with it. Like that ending...Rey Skywalker? Cringe to the max...

I think JJ did what he could. I'm happy my 12 year old sister enjoyed it. I put my self as that kid and it was awesome. Babu was great.

I was completely entertained and it ended like it has. The Last Jedi kinda was a second start the the sequels. The last Jedi had great moments. The force awakens was such a great setup but that's all. Its easy to forget. The rise of skywalker was just an ending. I cried but because Carries death because star wars meant some much. I like it its hard for me to hate it, that's ok. We can feel meh about it it's normal. We all can agree the sequels needed a direction, the expected the other directors to build of TFA but it blew up. Tbh the force awakens left a crack in the fandom and then the last Jedi completely severed it. And the Rise of skywalker tried to fix the tiny fragments, it was literally impossible task. But I'm happy I enjoyed it, and that's ok. And it's ok that others may hate it

snippet.textDisplay:
Hard to be entertained by a steaming pile of hot shit. They had a slew of resources by way of "LEGENDS" to make a solid piece of Star Wars cinema.

I give ROS a 4 out of 10. Not sure how this gets a C-, but I respect your opinion. This later trilogy sullied the legacy. In 20 years, this will still be shite. If Disney retcons this trilogy in favor of a Lucas' vision, that'd be redemptive.

The Mandalorian feels like Star Wars, hope it stays that way, and I've been enjoying watching the Clone Wars series. There will always be hope, but the Skywalker legacy will always mean something for the classic trilogy. Wish I could say the same for the sum of its entire cinematic parts.

snippet.textDisplay:
I really enjoyed the film, but it does have issues in it which are kind of present throughout the trilogy. I've made an analogy that kind of sums up this trilogy, which I call "The Mash Potato Dinner Party" and it goes like this:

JJ Abrams has a load of people round and gives them all extremely small portions of some mashed potato that he's made. Half of the people there say things like "This is amazing, can I have some more of this?" and "What's your secret?" He replies with a smile "There'll be more of this coming as the evening progresses and I'll tell you all about my secret method later" Whereas others are saying "This is no different to any mash I've ever tasted before, in fact, it's exactly the same as the mash I always have. This is so unoriginal" He then realises they are low on drinks, so goes out to purchase some more and asks his housemate, Rian Johnson, to watch over the guests.


Rian Johnson then enters the room and scrapes JJ's mash into the bin, and when there isn't enough room for it all, he throws the rest out of the window, into the garden. He then presents the guests with bowls of porridge that have orange juice, chocolate and lard all mixed in it. Some of the guests are saying "Wow, this is so different and is like nothing I've ever tried before, I loved it" and "This is great because we were only expecting mash and this has really surprised me" Or, 'subverted my expectations', you might say 😉 Others are saying "What about JJ's mash? and what's his secret?" Rian responds "We aren't having mash anymore and there's no secret, it was just store bought" People then start complaining, saying the food is disgusting and Rian responds with things like "You just don't know good food" and "You're just ungrateful, if you don't like it then get out of my house" He then receives a phone call and leaves the room, when JJ returns.


He tells everyone that someone phoned him telling him what Rian had done, so he went around asking everyone's families how they liked their mash and he has now made 10 different types and has also bought some ready made stuff. Instead of asking each guest how they like it, he's just piling bits of every mash on everyone's plates. Whilst doing this, he also takes the porridge Rian made off everyone's plates, even off the plates of the guests who liked it! He also scrapes the potato Rian threw away out of the bin and out of the garden, dumping them on people's plates too. He then adds double the amount of milk and butter to his own mash, which he also dollops on their plates as well. He doesn't even give people time to finish the mash already on their plates, before shoving even more on them. He also spends the remainder of the evening telling people what the method for his mash was, before giving them all a laminated piece of paper each with it written on to take home. Some of them leave only liking JJ's mash, some only liked Rian's porridge, some got annoyed with the inconsistency of the evening and others enjoyed the whole thing, but it was ruined by others complaining, meaning no one walked away completely satisfied.

snippet.textDisplay: I disagree that the Sequel Trilogy was a direct result of them listening to the fans. The opposite is the truth. Sure, Episode 7 was a return to form because of the prequels; however, Rian Johnson CLEARLY didn't create Episode 8 because he wanted to please fans, he wanted to be a bull in a china shop. His reaction to fans after the fact is proof he never really cared about Star Wars, he wanted to do his own thing, and got butt hurt when nobody liked it. Episode 9 had elements of fixing things the fans hated in Last Jedi, but let's face it, Jar Jar Abrams was trying to course correct the series the way HE originally wanted to see it go since Episode 7. Case in point: Rey. Fans have complained for years now she was a Mary Sue, and he continued to do the very things fans hated. Jar Jar Abrams had his own agenda in this film, the fans were just a second thought (but he thought of them more than Rian Johnson).

snippet.textDisplay:
Here's how I'd make the films. Have the knights of ren be the main villains instead of Palpatine or Snoke or even have the first order. Luke has his Jedi order and Leia is a jedi teacher. Leia has a cyan lightsaber and Luke still has his green one. Rey is a scavenger and found that she showed a little force potential when Luke found her trying to find students. Finn was part of an experiment to create force sensitive stormtroopers and was very young but the experiment fell after the empire fell. The knights are Vader fanatics seeking out sith holocrons that Vader left for a sinister purpose. Kylo has a green crossguard as the green crystal was gifted by Luke but was cracked when he damaged it in a fit of rage. I'd remove the bleeding crystal method as I find it unique if a dark sider has a non red blade and a light sider has a red blade. Rey has a double bladed purple lightsaber she constructs, and Finn has a standard blue one. Rey unlike in the movies we have seen, actually works hard and while she is talented she does actually get trained before she does the cool stuff. The knights also have red armored troopers similar to sith troopers as just body guards as well. Along the way to defeat them, they come across other force orders that are light sided, dark sided and even gray sided like the guardians of the breath and imperial knights and they all have their own agenda and beliefs.


Kylo does reform over time. Rey and Finn fall in love. Also it turns out that with all the warring factions, a sith lord named Jar Jar was behind everything as Jar Jar was a partner of Palpatine. Since Palpatine had an apprentice, Jar Jar laid low hence his absence in later movies until Palpatine was destroyed and JarJar would continue the rule of two sith, trying to find other force users to corrupt like Rey. Rey turns out to be Anakin Skywalker reincarnated. Anakin foresaw a sith lord in the future and other dark siders and so Anakin gave up immortality to reincarnate into another body. Hence why she has connections with Luke, Leia and Kylo and also why Anakin is absent as a ghost and also explains Rey's power. We'd see scenes of Rey interacting with her previous incarnation Anakin. Turns out Jar Jar was behind the clone wars, the empire and the warring factions between other force orders for a sinister purpose as well and it comes down to Rey and Finn and Kylo fighting against him, in his throne that looks similar to Palpatine's in TROS. Jar Jar shoots red force lightning and has a dark core unstable red lightsaber blade. Rey defeats him and the prophecy is fulfilled when other dark siders are destroyed and when she destroys the last of the sith as she is the chosen one reincarnated. What do you think? I think this would be better than what we got.

snippet.textDisplay:
Luke's arc was total garbage. Here is how you could have made this trilogy better:

1.) Make it that, instead of Luke in pouty exile for trying to kill Ben as a kid, make that Kylo fell to the darkside similar to Anakin; however, make it that Luke confronts him as an adult, before Episode 7, similar to Obi-Wan and Anakin in Episode 3. Instead of Luke winning, make it that Kylo maims Luke physically, and wrecks his connection to the force (almost in an interesting role reversal from Vader). Luke isn't in exile out of some crap decisions he made, but because he is literally useless.

2.) Make it so Rey goes darkside at the end of Episode 8. You can keep it so she is still Sidious's grand daughter, just don't make him alive. Make it so when Luke trains her in Episode 8 (desperate to stop rectify his failure from the point above) she still has an obvious, natural connection to the Dark Side. Fearful that he'll have a hand in creating another Kylo Ren, Luke refuses to train her. After the Throne Room fight, Rey, pissed off at Luke and everything that happened, goes full dark side without hesitation. This terrifies Kylo who, already feeling confilct from Han's death, sees how easy this was for Rey becomes motivated to rejoin the light side (do the opposite from Episode 8 and have Rey offer Kylo the chance to join her and he rejects her offer).

3.) Have Ben save the Resistance at the end of Episode 8, find Luke, and reconcile. Luke offers to finish Ben's training to stop Rey, who has become supreme leader of the First Order, making her the big bad of Episode 9.

snippet.textDisplay: It’s odd to me, Chris, that you can be frustrated by “finding stuff out about Rey” in the third film, when Abrams is the one who set up mystery box after mystery box, just to feed the hype. Who is Rey? Who is Snoke? Who are the Knights of Ren? And so many other questions were set up by Abrams. He answered NOTHING in HIS debut sequel film. He served us the imaginary food from Hook. I’m genuinely curious why you have bigger issues with Johnson when he was the one who wanted to take risks and tread new ground (not counting the casino planet, which feels a little bit like studio interference imo). I would really appreciate a video from you analyzing context, risk, and the writing decisions of the three films. A big task, but I would genuinely like to know your reasoning.

snippet.textDisplay:
Gonna Reply to the points made as I hear em because people need to read more books and pay more attention to established and explained information. Prep for edits.

1. Palpatine Looks like a zombie because he came back from the dead, which was his entire goal since he became a sith. To live and Rule for ever.

2. Its not the first Secret Military Force ever built. Just ask the clones and the fleets and fleets of Republic ships that magically appeared in Attack of the Clones. I grant you, they explained the clones but not the hundreds of Venators, Acclamtors and AT-TEs. Straight out of Palpatines playbook.

3. Rey had the heritage of the most powerful Sith to ever exist, access to ancient Jedi Texts, and partial training from both surviving Skywalker's. He she wasn't all powerful everyone would of bitched about her being too weak.

4. God not you too. Anakin saved his son and brought balance to the force. No one said that balance would last forever, Anakin saved the Galaxy, his Arc is something else completely. This doesn't change anything about his sacrifice, and to keep the balance Rey had to stop Palpatine. Two different unrelated equally important Arcs that people all bitch about ruining everything. Just stop, pay attention, remember context and stop bandwagoning. It doesn't change anything.

5. This movie retains many of the established things from TLJ, Force connections, depleted resistance forces, powerful dead force ghosts. This movie doesn't continue from TLJ very well but it keeps some of established fact which I respect.

6. Imagine if Palpatine didn't comeback, who would be the Villain, it can't be Kylo, because his Arc was the only universally appreciated Arc, it can't be Snoke because he legit just died and as much you didn't like Palpatine you would of hated Snoke more, Hux? Lol. Would you have Rathered a "one and done" big badie that we have no context for? JJ nailed it with palps you might dislike the overall sequel trilogy's lack of direction it you cannot fault this movie or JJ because of a corporate decision. JJ killed it for making an enjoyable movie from thin air after Johnson burned it all down.


I loved this movie, it brought a ton of EU into canon, had a great Arc for Kylo and nodded to fans enough for me to nod back.

snippet.textDisplay:
Star wars 7,8,9 went the way of the X-Men saga. Fun stories, that were all over the place.....creating in the end an entertaining glop in your living room instead of a cohesive masterpiece we all grew up with. I can say TLJ was bold and entertaining but really it's narrative of destroying "mystery boxes", was what sent the trilogy on the wrong path. Leaving TROS with nothing to do or say....

In short TFA: Hey I wanna tell you something exciting!
TLJ: Sike! There was no surprise, nothing matters!!! Haha!
ROS: umm, well you see actually ....[Sprint tells a story so fast you cant hear a thing] THE END.....was it good?

snippet.textDisplay: I enjoyed TROS because I think it did the best it could after TLJ, which I really did not like.  To me most of the main story complaints of TROS are because TLJ went in the complete opposite direction of TFA, so it felt like JJ had to bring the trilogy back on course with TROS. He had to explain so many things that should have been explained in TLJ. Disney should have just kept JJ on all 3 movies so that the story would have at least been consistent.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm not hating on this film. I liked it for what it was. I agree that Ben solo/ Kylo Ren arc was the best part of the trilogy. Rey's arc isn't actually from left field. The Timothy Zahn Trilogy in the 80s had clones of Palpatine coming back, and had Leia's and Han's son turning to the dark side. They should have just borrowed from that series as their road map and fans would have loved it.

The core issue is how Rian Johnson just took what Abrahms had set up and took a shit on it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Rey and Ren should not have had a romantic relationship. They had an almost bro/sis relationship and an amazing connection like the one Luke and Leia had... They never showed romantic interest in each other and for a while I had a theory they were cousins (she was luke’s daughter) you think they would be right? But nope this is a disney movie and they used the “I’m a boy she’s a girl let’s kiss” logic. It just makes so sence

Also I will never stop shipping Po and Finn... It should have been them as the couple of the movie lol

snippet.textDisplay: I will say I believe that the reason why the 6 movie GEORGE LUCAS, made were consistent, is because he MADE the story as he went along and how HE wanted it to go. If J. J Abrams made ALL 3 of these movies, there would be consistency and not only would Last Jedi be better but it would have better story, and The RoS would have had a better chance of being less confusing. Tbh like he said, the symbolism of the light saber, the Last Jedi Director just trashed shit and didnt do good, so with what Abrams had left, he did the best he could and in my opinion, with what he had left it was and ok movie, not good, but not bad. Also it is Disney so I wasnt expecting them to do well with these movies.
